page.title: 06 Garden Centre
page.content: {Quintrell Downs Garden Centre}is owned by Mr Curgenven who has owned it since 1946. He bought the seven acres of land when he came back from World War 2. Before he bought it his father used it to keep mixed animals on. Mr Curgenven is in charge of the main greenhouse where the plants are sold. He said the main bulk of customers come from a three to four mile radius but they get customers from all over Europe. The garden centre grows nearly all the plants they sell. The most popular plants are{roses}and{fuchias}.When they get insects on plants they throw the plants away before the insects can spread to other plants. The busiest time of the year is Spring and early Summer although the planting and growing continues all year.
